intro: Fumaria bulbosa subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate celandine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers bloom in early spring. It is often found growing in association with other herbaceous plants in its native habitat.
